summary: This is an email chain from August 14, 2019, discussing overtime staffing procedures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for the week of August 4-10, 2019. It details the breakdown of volunteer versus mandated overtime shifts and the process for filling vacancies, indicating a focus on staffing protocols at the facility.

events.title: Overtime Log Review Week Start
events.description: Review of overtime logs for mandatory vs. volunteer overtimes for the week of August 4-10, 2019, at MCC.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email about staffing procedures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) dated August 14, 2019.
It provides a detailed breakdown of overtime shifts (volunteer vs. mandated) for each day from August 4 to August 10, 2019.
The described process shows that custody staff are used first for overtime, followed by non-custody staff, then volunteers via email/radio, with mandates as a last resort for evening/morning shifts.
The email mentions attached sign-up logs covering July 14, 2019, to August 13, 2019.
The tone is collegial, with the sender thanking the recipient and their team for their work.
